overview:
Krista is the Founder of UsingMiles.com. Her core competencies reside in PR, sales, and business development.

She started UsingMiles.com after dealing with the frustration of losing over 26,000 miles in a major airline frequent flyer program and wondering why there wasn’t a better way to manage and use her miles and points.

Her professional experience commenced at Coca-Cola North America, where she developed and ran the fastest-growing sales territory in the country. She gradually moved into Marketing in Silicon Valley and ran the marketing efforts for an early start-up, Boomerang.com, that survived the dot bomb and continues to thrive.

She most recently concluded working at ShopAtHome.com, one of the top 10 trafficked online shopping sites according to the New York Times, where she grew Facebook likes from 0 to over 600,000, created an active blogger network resulting in over 800 posts a month and spearheaded the first PR strategy for the company.

Krista was accepted into the 2008 Techstars program in Boulder, Colorado. She is also a mentor for the Founder’s Institute program in Denver, Colorado, which helps early start-ups get off the ground.

Krista graduated Summa Cum Laude with highest honors from the University of Colorado, Boulder.
